definition: (category defined by the Communist Party) poor and lower-middle peasants: farmers who, before land reform, possessed little or no land (poor peasants) and those who were barely able to support themselves with their own land (lower-middle peasants)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: They classed as poor and lower-middle peasants at the time of the land reform.
sentences.chinese: 土地改革時他們被劃爲貧下中農。

sentences.english: Then a representative of the poor and lower middle class peasants would give us a report, telling of his miserable life before liberation.
sentences.chinese: 請來貧下中農的代表作報告，訴說解放前的苦難生活。

definition: lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
Zhang Tailei (1898-1927), founding member of Chinese communist party
Ruyuan Yao Autonomous County in Shaoguan 韶關|韶关[Shao2 guan1], Guangdong
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
to agree on three laws (idiom)/three-point covenant/(fig.) preliminary agreement/basic rules
